headline.main: Court Rejects Deal on Hiring in Silicon Valley
headline.print_headline: Court Rejects Deal on Hiring in Silicon Valley

docs.abstract: Judge Lucy H Koh of United States District Court in San Jose rejects as insufficient a proposed $324 million settlement in class-action antitrust case accusing leading technology companies of agreeing not to poach one another's engineers; ruling immediately resuscitates public relations nightmare for Google, Apple and other tech companies while vindicating range of observers who had said Silicon Valley was escaping justice.

byline.contributor: Brian X. Chen and Conor Dougherty contributed reporting.

headline.main: Why BuzzFeed Is Trying to Shift Its Strategy
headline.print_headline: Why BuzzFeed Is Trying to Shift Its Strategy

docs.abstract: The Upshot news analysis; Buzzfeed's focus on social media as way to distribute its content underscores how shifts in way people consume news online poses challenges for media companies; speed with which consumers change their media consumption habits is illustrated by fact that while Facebook is currently the primary place people look for news, Google has, until recently, pushed most traffic to new stories.
